intro: Alsine alpina, commonly known as alpine sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 5–20 centimeters. The plant features small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually linear and covered in fine hairs, adapted to thrive in arid or rocky environments. Alsine alpina is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia, where it often grows in dry, sandy soils.
